snippet: When the setting’s flamboyant and the view is free, you socialize first and (maybe) pay later.
abstract: Loreen Arbus turns large, elegantly understated apartment on Central Park West into flamboyant place, filled with bright murals, red-velvet couches and painted chandeliers, that friends and strangers would want to see and that she, and her teacup poodle, can call home.
lead_paragraph: When the setting’s flamboyant and the view is free, you socialize first and (maybe) pay later.
